snippet: A federal investigative agency is examining 67 claims of retaliation by supervisors at the Department of Veterans Affairs against employees who filed whistle-blower complaints — including 25 complaints filed since June 1, after a growing health...
abstract: Independent Office of Special Counsel, a federal agency, is investigating claims from 67 employees at Veterans Affairs Dept that they were subjected to retaliation by supervisors after filing whistle-blower complains about long patient waits and falsified records.
lead_paragraph: A federal investigative agency is examining 67 claims of retaliation by supervisors at the Department of Veterans Affairs against employees who filed whistle-blower complaints — including 25 complaints filed since June 1, after a growing health care scandal involving long patient waits and falsified records at department hospitals and clinics became public.

headline.main: V.A. Is Accused of Retaliating in 67 Complaint Cases
headline.print_headline: V.A. Is Accused of Retaliating in 67 Complaint Cases

keywords.value: United States Office of Special Counsel
